title: Calgary (City of) v. International Association of Fire Fighters (Local 255), 2006 ABQB 133
notes: Alberta Court of Queen's Bench decision in which part of the case (see para. 92+) revolved around drafting confusion around small-B "benefit" and capital-B "Benefit"; I use this when trying to convince lawyers that capitalized formal terms are problematic. If there's only one of a thing, it doesn't need a cap, and if there's more of one thing, then a capital letter isn't sufficient differentiation.
